title: The Shadow Ballot
outcome: A mysterious citizen 'Shadow Ballot' emerges in the Halden Zones, prompting people to rank key values, with the BCI shifting its behavior by district. The Council is thrown into deeper conflict as people seize newfound influence and society polarizes along new lines of identity and priorities.

events.description: Residents in several Halden Zones receive cryptic invitations to participate in a 'Shadow Ballot.' Instead of candidates, the system asks people to rank values like safety, freedom, and fairness.
Sudden shifts appear: neighborhoods with different top-ranked values see changes in public services and enforcement, causing confusion and excitement.

Council factions clash. Harmonists call for control, Directorate demands a crackdown, while Innovators argue for studying the effect. Old debates about Halden’s ethics resurfaced when evidence ties the ballot to his past pilot simulation.
Civic life begins to polarize along value lines: some districts celebrate newfound autonomy, others protest sudden loss of status-quo. Tensions rise as BCI scoring visibly changes week-to-week.
With the system adapting to local values, new forms of solidarity and division appear. Emerging city-wide solidarity movements call for a transparent, citizen-led BCI—or its complete abolition.
